sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
An elegy upon the unfortunate death of Captain William Bedloe, who departed this life, on Fryday the twentieth of August. 1680.
1 sheet ([1] p.).
Printed for John Gay, at the Flying-Horse between St. Dunstan's Church and Chancery-Lane., London, : 1680.
Verse: "How fickle is the state of all mankind? ..." Within mourning borders, with emblems and motto. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======

Verse: "How fickle is the state of all mankind? ..." Within mourning borders, with emblems and motto. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
John Gay
the Flying-Horse between St. Dunstan's Church
